About.title: Little about me
About.p1: I'm a software engineer based in Montreal with a passion for solving real-life problems through coding. After briefly pursuing a career in soccer, I realized coding was my true calling. Now, as a full stack engineer at GoTo, I face new challenges daily, and continue working on personal projects in my free time. My competitive mindset, honed from sports, drives my work ethic and passion for development.

Introduction.I'm a full-stack developer with backgrou: I'm a full-stack developer with background experience in building complex platforms and designs.

Soft.title: My soft skills
Soft.adaptability: Quickly adjust to new situations or requirements
Soft.learning: Hungry for new knowledge and skills
Soft.problemSolving: Identify and resolve complex issues efficiently
Soft.resilience: Very good at motivating myself because I take joy in coding
Soft.teamwork: Collaborate effectively with others towards common goals

Cloud.title: Infrastructure stack
Cloud.tools: Used Terraform and Ansible in some projects I run (mostly pickside)
Cloud.aws: AWS -> Knows a lot about EC2, ECS, ECR and many more...
Cloud.experience: Always trying different tools, and compare cost & services between them
Cloud.challenges: Understand cloud cost challenges and always looking for the best way to minimize cost on services

Dev.title: Software stack
Dev.authentication: Built my own authentication server for my pickside app project. Great way to learn how it's done.
Dev.stack: I use Go and React/Tailwind/CSS everyday. Also learning C in my free time.
Dev.docker: I use Docker every day for local development + as a deployment tool.
Dev.versionning: I use Git everyday and Github for versionning my projects.

Devops.title: Devops knowledge
Devops.integration: Worked in several multi-system integration environments
Devops.microservices: Know how to work in a microservice driven project
Devops.automation: Know how to automate a development process using tools like Github actions, Jenkins or Concourse
Devops.security: Understand the importance of security practices such as using a vault storing secrets
Devops.commits: Use semantic commits when coding, drafts release every functionning version
Devops.scripts: Program small scripts that help me in my automation process such as upgrading & commiting a new version for a microservice
Devops.containerize: Containerize my services for easy deployment

Contact.title: Contact
Contact.Description: If you are looking for someone to work with or even just to discuss, please feel free to contact me.

Design.title: Design
Design.a: A figma design with of how your website will look like
Design.b: Unlimited calls to go over your design

SinglePage.title: One page
SinglePage.a: Could be a portfolio to showcase your skills
SinglePage.b: Could be a blog page that will allow you to post content about your favorite subjects
SinglePage.d: Could be an event promotion website

Custom.title: Custom
Custom.e: Will include SEO (Search engine Optimization) to index your website amongst the first results

Resume.Role: Experienced full-stack engineer focused on building accessible & custom experience

GoTo.summary: I contribute to the development of a top-notch SaaS business communication tool, focusing on customer-facing features. My work ensures the platform remains high quality and robust, delivering a seamless experience for users.
GoTo.a: Developed 30+ core features, helping at least 85% of the existing clients move away from the legacy platform of a $4B company
GoTo.c: Took initiative to add a refactoring sprints to gradually shorten the code debt gap
GoTo.d: Constantly collaborating with UI/UX and other teams to establish specifications and system designs
GoTo.e: Oversaw the review and coding standard of new features
GoTo.f: Documented design workflow and technical aspects of new features, as well as tracking their progress
GoTo.g: Presented and conveyed ideas and designs approach with UX partners and Manager engineers
GoTo.h: Built small automated scripts to assist my feature deployment process, increasing my productivity by at least 10%

Desjardins.summary: Contributed to the development of a secured messaging platform for internal use with outside customer, where both parties can share documents, send and receive messages alongside other features. Working there also gave me hands-on experience with security management since it was a bank, and information is extremely sensitive. The backend worked as a microservice approach and I was responsible for one of them, therefore I learned to develop a REST backend with SpringBoot and a lot of experience with pipeline deployment.
Desjardins.a: Led the development and introduced rigorous coding standards for the frontend application using Typescript and StencilJS
Desjardins.b: Developed micro-frontend services, with each 20+ custom reusable components
Desjardins.c: Developed one of the 3 microservices Rest APIs used for the platform's authentication service using Spring and PKCE
Desjardins.d: Configured a deployment pipeline for each microservice I developed, and added quality gate control with threshold of 80% test passing for the BFF
Desjardins.e: Developed unit tests & integration tests using JUnit5/JaCoCo for for the backend, and Jest/Puppeteer for Stencil

Bell.summary: Led the development of a fully functional JIRA-like dashboard helping internal employees with their morning stand-ups. My work impacted their schedules and allowed them to be 70% more productive everyday. I took charge in setting up the code structure and using what I had at the time, very small knowledge of EmberJS. I also had the chance to work on the REST backend which was developed in C#.
Bell.a: Built a fully functional internal dashboard connected to a SAP database, helping on-site teams boost their productivity by 70% and saving them 5 hours every week
Bell.b: Introduced a solid component oriented design structure, improving the developers' efficiency to work with the code base
Bell.c: Mentored interns and seniors on EmberJS
Bell.d: Helped optimizing a big relational database driven by a complex business logic and reduced the amount of queries needed by 2%
Bell.e: Released 30+ features following the agile development practice

Ubisoft.summary: Ubisoft was my first job, as an intern and is also where I discovered my love for frontend development. I was responsible to develop some widgets with PolymerJS, a web components library developed by Google. I used my almost-to-no knowledge on component design approach (at the time) to learn a create my first widget.
Ubisoft.a: Built a fully functional iFrame widget that can receive & send events from the dashboard it is attached to using PolymerJS and Typescript
Ubisoft.b: Built 2+ widgets that were connected to a dashboard mostly for user metrics
Ubisoft.c: Learned about the agile development process and put it to practice
Ubisoft.e: Attended over 100+ meetings during my internship

Discord.summary: I developed a discord bot with a music queue functionality, for my friends and I.
Discord.a: Developed a Discord Bot that plays music for my group of friends using NodeJS, incorporating a custom-made queue system with features like previous, pause, play, and next. This implementation utilized prebuilt libraries such as Discord.js 13 and ytdl for playing Youtube music
Discord.b: Configured an EC2 server instance to host my Discord bot using a prebuilt library package called pm2, which effectively runs Node projects as processes, enabling the bot to operate 24/7
Discord.c: Pursued Ansible and Terraform as hobbies to acquire automation skills, successfully automating the process of setting up an EC2 server with all the necessary packages to run the Discord bot

Pickside.summary: Pickside is an app that is still in development. It aims to be a platform where people can plan sporting events on outdoor/indoor fields, find teams and groups to play with.
Pickside.summarywithstack: Pickside: Event planning app â€“ Go, MySQL, MySQL, AWS, React
Pickside.a: Developed a sporting event manager web app that allows users to plan outdoor activities related to sports using ReactJS, Redux-Thunk, TailwindCSS, and HTML
Pickside.b: Created a RESTful service backend using NodeJS/ExpressJS and Mongoose, which connects to a MongoDB server for data storage
Pickside.c: Implemented my own authentication process as a way to learn the process, also supporting Google authentication
Pickside.d: Integrated a Swagger endpoint for documentation purposes
Pickside.e: Created a messaging system using websockets
Pickside.h: Using no third party library other than Tailwind for CSS
Pickside.i: Utilized Google's Places library to connect a map and search for locations

PortfolioV1.summary: First portfolio I ever developed with React.
PortfolioV1.a: Developed a static page with the help of React and TailwindCSS
PortfolioV1.c: Integrated EmailJS library with a form to contact me
PortfolioV1.d: Integrated a language switcher using i18next
PortfolioV1.e: Integrated a PDF downloader using @react-pdf/renderer, also supports localization
PortfolioV1.f: Statically hosted on an S3 bucket
PortfolioV1.g: Gained a comprehensive understanding of using aws-cli commands

PortfolioV2.summary: This is a second version of my portfolio developed with NextJS & typescript.
PortfolioV2.a: Developed a portfolio/profile website with no backend, utilizing React 18 and TailwindCSS
PortfolioV2.b: Designed and implemented custom-made components such as Dialogs, Buttons, LanguageSwitchers, and Spinners
PortfolioV2.c: Implemented a small contact form that allows visitors to reach out via Email using the EmailJS library
PortfolioV2.d: Integrated a language switcher (FR, EN) using i18next for improved user experience
PortfolioV2.e: Implemeted a PDF download option for my curriculum that supports both languages
PortfolioV2.f: Set up an S3 bucket to statically host this project under a purchased domain, ensuring secure HTTPS protocol
PortfolioV2.g: Gained a comprehensive understanding of using aws-cli commands

Sadbois.summary: This project is my first ever introduction to React. It was supposed to be an online store with for selling merchandise but the project never finished.
Sadbois.a: Developed a very small E-Commerce website as a project for friends, although it was never completed. The development involved using React, Redux-Thunk, HTML, CSS, and SCSS
Sadbois.b: Implemented a fully functional cart system, a basic login system, and a semi-functional PayPal integration for processing payments
Sadbois.c: Created a backend REST service that seamlessly connects to a SQL database system
Sadbois.d: Set up migration files to facilitate data initialization during fresh runs, specifically for development purposes
